Package com.Akif

Class SimpleTextEditor

java.lang.Object
com.Akif.SimpleTextEditor
public class SimpleTextEditor
extends java.lang.Object
This class provides the some of the edit functionality of a text editor. To keep the text by using a java list, list stores each character of text. To use this class you need to specify which list you will use.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SimpleTextEditor​(java.util.List<java.lang.Character> listType)
    One parameter constructor initializes the list according to specified type.

    This method adds one or more characters (given as a string) at the specified position (given as an integer index) in the text.

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleTextEditor

      public SimpleTextEditor​(java.util.List<java.lang.Character> listType)
      One parameter constructor initializes the list according to specified type.
      Parameters:
      listType - type of list that you will use.

  • Method Details

    • read

      public void read​(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method to read from a text file which is specified and construct the text. It uses add method of the list and simple loop structure.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the file that will be read the text.

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String newItem, int index)
      This method adds one or more characters (given as a string) at the specified position (given as an integer index) in the text. It uses simple for loop with index structure to add.
      Parameters:
      newItem - characters to add.
      index - specified position to add.

    • find

      public int find​(java.lang.String searchItem)
      This method returns the start index of the first occurrence of the searched group of characters. It uses simple for loop with index structure to find.
      Parameters:
      searchItem - group of characters to be searched
      Returns:
      start index of the first occurrence of the searched group of characters.

    • replaceAll

      public void replaceAll​(char oldCh, char newCh)
      This method replaces all occurrences of a character with another character in the text. It uses simple for loop with index structure to replace.
      Parameters:
      oldCh - a character to be changed.
      newCh - a character to be replaced with old character.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the text as a string
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the text as a string

    • readByIterator

      public void readByIterator​(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method to read from a text file which is specified and construct the text. It uses add method of the iterator (ListIterator) and navigates on the List.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the file that will be read the text.

    • addByIterator

      public void addByIterator​(java.lang.String newItem, int index)
      This method adds one or more characters (given as a string) at the specified position (given as an integer index) in the text. It uses iterator(ListIterator) to navigate on the List to add.
      Parameters:
      newItem - characters to add.
      index - specified position to add.

    • findByIterator

      public int findByIterator​(java.lang.String searchItem)
      This method returns the start index of the first occurrence of the searched group of characters. It uses iterator(ListIterator) to navigate on the List to find.
      Parameters:
      searchItem - group of characters to be searched
      Returns:
      start index of the first occurrence of the searched group of characters.

    • replaceAllByIterator

      public void replaceAllByIterator​(char oldCh, char newCh)
      This method replaces all occurrences of a character with another character in the text. It uses iterator(ListIterator) to navigate on the List to replace.
      Parameters:
      oldCh - a character to be changed.
      newCh - a character to be replaced with old character.
